Resources.Name: Condition
Resources.Description: Creates a condition

relationaloperator.Description: Relational Operator to be used with threshold.

account.Description: the account of the condition. Must be used with the domainId parameter.

domainid.Description: the domain ID of the account.

Resources.Name: NicToVirtualMachine
Resources.Description: Adds VM to specified network by creating a NIC

ipaddress.Description: IP Address for the new network

Resources.Name: VpnConnection
Resources.Description: Create site to site vpn connection

Resources.Name: SecurityGroupIngress
Resources.Description: Authorizes a particular ingress rule for this security group

endport.Description: end port for this ingress rule

securitygroupid.Description: The ID of the security group. Mutually exclusive with securityGroupName parameter

protocol.Description: TCP is default. UDP is the other supported protocol

icmpcode.Description: error code for this icmp message

startport.Description: start port for this ingress rule

projectid.Description: an optional project of the security group

securitygroupname.Description: The name of the security group. Mutually exclusive with securityGroupName parameter

icmptype.Description: type of the icmp message being sent

account.Description: an optional account for the security group. Must be used with domainId.

domainid.Description: an optional domainId for the security group. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used.

Resources.Name: Template
Resources.Description: Creates a template of a virtual machine. The virtual machine must be in a STOPPED state. A template created from this command is automatically designated as a private template visible to the account that created it.

displaytext.Description: the display text of the template. This is usually used for display purposes.

ostypeid.Description: the ID of the OS Type that best represents the OS of this template.

snapshotid.Description: the ID of the snapshot the template is being created from. Either this parameter, or volumeId has to be passed in

virtualmachineid.Description: Optional, VM ID. If this presents, it is going to create a baremetal template for VM this ID refers to. This is only for VM whose hypervisor type is BareMetal

requireshvm.Description: true if the template requres HVM, false otherwise

ispublic.Description: true if this template is a public template, false otherwise

volumeid.Description: the ID of the disk volume the template is being created from. Either this parameter, or snapshotId has to be passed in

url.Description: Optional, only for baremetal hypervisor. The directory name where template stored on CIFS server

isdynamicallyscalable.Description: true if template contains XS/VMWare tools inorder to support dynamic scaling of VM cpu/memory

passwordenabled.Description: true if the template supports the password reset feature; default is false

isfeatured.Description: true if this template is a featured template, false otherwise

Resources.Name: Network
Resources.Description: Creates a network

displaytext.Description: the display text of the network

zoneid.Description: the Zone ID for the network

projectid.Description: an optional project for the ssh key

startip.Description: the beginning IP address in the network IP range

domainid.Description: domain ID of the account owning a network

displaynetwork.Description: an optional field, whether to the display the network to the end user or not.

startipv6.Description: the beginning IPv6 address in the IPv6 network range

acltype.Description: Access control type; supported values are account and domain. In 3.0 all shared networks should have aclType=Domain, and all Isolated networks - Account. Account means that only the account owner can use the network, domain - all accouns in the domain can use the network

endip.Description: the ending IP address in the network IP range. If not specified, will be defaulted to startIP

account.Description: account who will own the network

gateway.Description: the gateway of the network. Required for Shared networks and Isolated networks when it belongs to VPC

vlan.Description: the ID or VID of the network

endipv6.Description: the ending IPv6 address in the IPv6 network range

ip6cidr.Description: the CIDR of IPv6 network, must be at least /64

aclid.Description: Network ACL Id associated for the network

isolatedpvlan.Description: the isolated private vlan for this network

ip6gateway.Description: the gateway of the IPv6 network. Required for Shared networks and Isolated networks when it belongs to VPC

netmask.Description: the netmask of the network. Required for Shared networks and Isolated networks when it belongs to VPC

subdomainaccess.Description: Defines whether to allow subdomains to use networks dedicated to their parent domain(s). Should be used with aclType=Domain, defaulted to allow.subdomain.network.access global config if not specified

physicalnetworkid.Description: the Physical Network ID the network belongs to

Resources.Name: Volume
Resources.Description: Attaches a disk volume to a virtual machine.

id.Description: the ID of the disk volume

virtualmachineid.Description: the ID of the virtual machine

deviceid.Description: the ID of the device to map the volume to within the guest OS. If no deviceId is passed in, the next available deviceId will be chosen. Possible values for a Linux OS are:* 1 - /dev/xvdb* 2 - /dev/xvdc* 4 - /dev/xvde* 5 - /dev/xvdf* 6 - /dev/xvdg* 7 - /dev/xvdh* 8 - /dev/xvdi* 9 - /dev/xvdj

Resources.Name: AffinityGroup
Resources.Description: Creates an affinity/anti-affinity group

type.Description: Type of the affinity group from the available affinity/anti-affinity group types

domainid.Description: domainId of the account owning the affinity group

account.Description: an account for the affinity group. Must be used with domainId.

description.Description: optional description of the affinity group

Resources.Name: AutoScaleVmProfile
Resources.Description: Creates a profile that contains information about the virtual machine which will be provisioned automatically by autoscale feature.

zoneid.Description: availability zone for the auto deployed virtual machine

serviceofferingid.Description: the service offering of the auto deployed virtual machine

templateid.Description: the template of the auto deployed virtual machine

otherdeployparams.Description: parameters other than zoneId/serviceOfferringId/templateId of the auto deployed virtual machine

destroyvmgraceperiod.Description: the time allowed for existing connections to get closed before a vm is destroyed

autoscaleuserid.Description: the ID of the user used to launch and destroy the VMs

Resources.Name: SecurityGroup
Resources.Description: Creates a security group

description.Description: the description of the security group

domainid.Description: an optional domainId for the security group. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used.

account.Description: an optional account for the security group. Must be used with domainId.

Resources.Name: SSHKeyPair
Resources.Description: Create a new keypair and returns the private key

account.Description: an optional account for the ssh key. Must be used with domainId.

domainid.Description: an optional domainId for the ssh key. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used.

projectid.Description: an optional project for the ssh key

Resources.Name: GlobalLoadBalancerRule
Resources.Description: Creates a global load balancer rule

regionid.Description: region where the global load balancer is going to be created.

gslbdomainname.Description: domain name for the GSLB service.

name.Description: name of the load balancer rule

account.Description: the account associated with the global load balancer. Must be used with the domainId parameter.

domainid.Description: the domain ID associated with the load balancer

gslbstickysessionmethodname.Description: session sticky method (sourceip) if not specified defaults to sourceip

description.Description: the description of the load balancer rule

gslblbmethod.Description: load balancer algorithm (roundrobin, leastconn, proximity) that method is used to distribute traffic across the zones participating in global server load balancing, if not specified defaults to 'round robin'

Resources.Name: StaticRoute
Resources.Description: Creates a static route

gatewayid.Description: the gateway id we are creating static route for

Resources.Name: VMSnapshot
Resources.Description: Creates snapshot for a vm.

name.Description: The display name of the snapshot

Resources.Name: StaticNat
Resources.Description: Enables static nat for given ip address

ipaddressid.Description: the public IP address id for which static nat feature is being enabled

virtualmachineid.Description: the ID of the virtual machine for enabling static nat feature

networkid.Description: The network of the vm the static nat will be enabled for. Required when public Ip address is not associated with any Guest network yet (VPC case)

vmguestip.Description: VM guest nic Secondary ip address for the port forwarding rule

Resources.Name: IpForwardingRule
Resources.Description: Creates an ip forwarding rule

ipaddressid.Description: the public IP address id of the forwarding rule, already associated via associateIp

protocol.Description: the protocol for the rule. Valid values are TCP or UDP.

startport.Description: the start port for the rule

cidrlist.Description: the cidr list to forward traffic from

endport.Description: the end port for the rule

openfirewall.Description: if true, firewall rule for source/end pubic port is automatically created; if false - firewall rule has to be created explicitely. Has value true by default

Resources.Name: LoadBalancer
Resources.Description: Creates a Load Balancer

sourceport.Description: the source port the network traffic will be load balanced from

scheme.Description: the load balancer scheme. Supported value in this release is Internal

networkid.Description: The guest network the Load Balancer will be created for

sourceipaddressnetworkid.Description: the network id of the source ip address

instanceport.Description: the TCP port of the virtual machine where the network traffic will be load balanced to

description.Description: the description of the Load Balancer

sourceipaddress.Description: the source ip address the network traffic will be load balanced from

Resources.Name: VirtualMachine
Resources.Description: Creates and automatically starts a virtual machine based on a service offering, disk offering, and template.

templateid.Description: the ID of the template for the virtual machine

serviceofferingid.Description: the ID of the service offering for the virtual machine

zoneid.Description: availability zone for the virtual machine

securitygroupnames.Description: comma separated list of security groups names that going to be applied to the virtual machine. Should be passed only when vm is created from a zone with Basic Network support. Mutually exclusive with securitygroupids parameter

affinitygroupids.Description: comma separated list of affinity groups id that are going to be applied to the virtual machine. Mutually exclusive with affinitygroupnames parameter

startvm.Description: true if network offering supports specifying ip ranges; defaulted to true if not specified

displayvm.Description: an optional field, whether to the display the vm to the end user or not.

diskofferingid.Description: the ID of the disk offering for the virtual machine. If the template is of ISO format, the diskOfferingId is for the root disk volume. Otherwise this parameter is used to indicate the offering for the data disk volume. If the templateId parameter passed is from a Template object, the diskOfferingId refers to a DATA Disk Volume created. If the templateId parameter passed is from an ISO object, the diskOfferingId refers to a ROOT Disk Volume created.

hypervisor.Description: the hypervisor on which to deploy the virtual machine

keyboard.Description: an optional keyboard device type for the virtual machine. valid value can be one of de,de-ch,es,fi,fr,fr-be,fr-ch,is,it,jp,nl-be,no,pt,uk,us

name.Description: host name for the virtual machine

iptonetworklist.Description: ip to network mapping. Can't be specified with networkIds parameter. Example: iptonetworklist[0].ip=10.10.10.11&iptonetworklist[0].ipv6=fc00:1234:5678::abcd&iptonetworklist[0].networkid=uuid - requests to use ip 10.10.10.11 in network id=uuid

networkids.Description: list of network ids used by virtual machine. Can't be specified with ipToNetworkList parameter

account.Description: an optional account for the virtual machine. Must be used with domainId.

userdata.Description: an optional binary data that can be sent to the virtual machine upon a successful deployment. This binary data must be base64 encoded before adding it to the request. Using HTTP GET (via querystring), you can send up to 2KB of data after base64 encoding. Using HTTP POST(via POST body), you can send up to 32K of data after base64 encoding.

keypair.Description: name of the ssh key pair used to login to the virtual machine

ipaddress.Description: the ip address for default vm's network

displayname.Description: an optional user generated name for the virtual machine

ip6address.Description: the ipv6 address for default vm's network

affinitygroupnames.Description: comma separated list of affinity groups names that are going to be applied to the virtual machine.Mutually exclusive with affinitygroupids parameter

domainid.Description: an optional domainId for the virtual machine. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used.

size.Description: the arbitrary size for the DATADISK volume. Mutually exclusive with diskOfferingId

hostid.Description: destination Host ID to deploy the VM to - parameter available for root admin only

securitygroupids.Description: comma separated list of security groups id that going to be applied to the virtual machine. Should be passed only when vm is created from a zone with Basic Network support. Mutually exclusive with securitygroupnames parameter

group.Description: an optional group for the virtual machine

Resources.Name: NetworkACLList
Resources.Description: Creates a Network ACL for the given VPC

vpcid.Description: Id of the VPC associated with this network ACL List

name.Description: Name of the network ACL List

description.Description: Description of the network ACL List

Resources.Name: PortForwardingRule
Resources.Description: Creates a port forwarding rule

privateport.Description: the starting port of port forwarding rule's private port range

protocol.Description: the protocol for the port fowarding rule. Valid values are TCP or UDP.

ipaddressid.Description: the IP address id of the port forwarding rule

virtualmachineid.Description: the ID of the virtual machine for the port forwarding rule

publicport.Description: the starting port of port forwarding rule's public port range

privateendport.Description: the ending port of port forwarding rule's private port range

cidrlist.Description: the cidr list to forward traffic from

vmguestip.Description: VM guest nic Secondary ip address for the port forwarding rule

networkid.Description: The network of the vm the Port Forwarding rule will be created for. Required when public Ip address is not associated with any Guest network yet (VPC case)

publicendport.Description: the ending port of port forwarding rule's private port range

openfirewall.Description: if true, firewall rule for source/end pubic port is automatically created; if false - firewall rule has to be created explicitely. If not specified 1) defaulted to false when PF rule is being created for VPC guest network 2) in all other cases defaulted to true

Resources.Name: EgressFirewallRule
Resources.Description: Creates a egress firewall rule for a given network

networkid.Description: the network id of the port forwarding rule

protocol.Description: the protocol for the firewall rule. Valid values are TCP/UDP/ICMP.

icmpcode.Description: error code for this icmp message

cidrlist.Description: the cidr list to forward traffic from

endport.Description: the ending port of firewall rule

icmptype.Description: type of the icmp message being sent

startport.Description: the starting port of firewall rule

Resources.Name: ToGlobalLoadBalancerRule
Resources.Description: Assign load balancer rule or list of load balancer rules to a global load balancer rules.

id.Description: the ID of the global load balancer rule

loadbalancerrulelist.Description: the list load balancer rules that will be assigned to gloabal load balacner rule

gslblbruleweightsmap.Description: Map of LB rule id's and corresponding weights (between 1-100) in the GSLB rule, if not specified weight of a LB rule is defaulted to 1. Specified as 'gslblbruleweightsmap[0].loadbalancerid=UUID&gslblbruleweightsmap[0].weight=10'

Resources.Name: InstanceGroup
Resources.Description: Creates a vm group

name.Description: the name of the instance group

account.Description: the account of the instance group. The account parameter must be used with the domainId parameter.

projectid.Description: The project of the instance group

domainid.Description: the domain ID of account owning the instance group

Resources.Name: IpToNic
Resources.Description: Assigns secondary IP to NIC

nicid.Description: the ID of the nic to which you want to assign private IP

Resources.Name: AutoScaleVmGroup
Resources.Description: Creates and automatically starts a virtual machine based on a service offering, disk offering, and template.

maxmembers.Description: the maximum number of members in the vmgroup, The number of instances in the vm group will be equal to or less than this number.

minmembers.Description: the minimum number of members in the vmgroup, the number of instances in the vm group will be equal to or more than this number.

lbruleid.Description: the ID of the load balancer rule

vmprofileid.Description: the autoscale profile that contains information about the vms in the vm group.

interval.Description: the frequency at which the conditions have to be evaluated

Resources.Name: LBHealthCheckPolicy
Resources.Description: Creates a Load Balancer healthcheck policy

lbruleid.Description: the ID of the load balancer rule

responsetimeout.Description: Time to wait when receiving a response from the health check (2sec - 60 sec)

unhealthythreshold.Description: Number of consecutive health check failures before declaring an instance unhealthy

description.Description: the description of the load balancer HealthCheck policy

intervaltime.Description: Amount of time between health checks (1 sec - 20940 sec)

healthythreshold.Description: Number of consecutive health check success before declaring an instance healthy

Resources.Name: VpnCustomerGateway
Resources.Description: Creates site to site vpn customer gateway

esppolicy.Description: ESP policy of the customer gateway

ikepolicy.Description: IKE policy of the customer gateway

ipsecpsk.Description: IPsec Preshared-Key of the customer gateway

cidrlist.Description: guest cidr list of the customer gateway

gateway.Description: public ip address id of the customer gateway

esplifetime.Description: Lifetime of phase 2 VPN connection to the customer gateway, in seconds

dpd.Description: If DPD is enabled for VPN connection

domainid.Description: the domain ID associated with the gateway. If used with the account parameter returns the gateway associated with the account for the specified domain.

ikelifetime.Description: Lifetime of phase 1 VPN connection to the customer gateway, in seconds

account.Description: the account associated with the gateway. Must be used with the domainId parameter.

Resources.Name: VpnGateway
Resources.Description: Creates site to site vpn local gateway

vpcid.Description: public ip address id of the vpn gateway

Resources.Name: SecurityGroupEgress
Resources.Description: Authorizes a particular egress rule for this security group

securitygroupname.Description: The name of the security group. Mutually exclusive with securityGroupName parameter

account.Description: an optional account for the security group. Must be used with domainId.

endport.Description: end port for this egress rule

protocol.Description: TCP is default. UDP is the other supported protocol

domainid.Description: an optional domainId for the security group. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used.

icmptype.Description: type of the icmp message being sent

startport.Description: start port for this egress rule

icmpcode.Description: error code for this icmp message

projectid.Description: an optional project of the security group

securitygroupid.Description: The ID of the security group. Mutually exclusive with securityGroupName parameter

Resources.Name: Iso
Resources.Description: Attaches an ISO to a virtual machine.

id.Description: the ID of the ISO file

virtualmachineid.Description: the ID of the virtual machine

Resources.Name: Tags
Resources.Description: Creates resource tag(s)

resourceids.Description: list of resources to create the tags for

customer.Description: identifies client specific tag. When the value is not null, the tag can't be used by cloudStack code internally

Resources.Name: AutoScaleVmGroup
Resources.Description: Enables an AutoScale Vm Group

id.Description: the ID of the autoscale group

Resources.Name: SnapshotPolicy
Resources.Description: Creates a snapshot policy for the account.

volumeid.Description: the ID of the disk volume

maxsnaps.Description: maximum number of snapshots to retain

schedule.Description: time the snapshot is scheduled to be taken. Format is:* if HOURLY, MM* if DAILY, MM:HH* if WEEKLY, MM:HH:DD (1-7)* if MONTHLY, MM:HH:DD (1-28)

intervaltype.Description: valid values are HOURLY, DAILY, WEEKLY, and MONTHLY

timezone.Description: Specifies a timezone for this command. For more information on the timezone parameter, see Time Zone Format.

Resources.Name: NetworkACL
Resources.Description: Creates a ACL rule in the given network (the network has to belong to VPC)

protocol.Description: the protocol for the ACL rule. Valid values are TCP/UDP/ICMP/ALL or valid protocol number

networkid.Description: The network of the vm the ACL will be created for

action.Description: scl entry action, allow or deny

traffictype.Description: the traffic type for the ACL,can be Ingress or Egress, defaulted to Ingress if not specified

cidrlist.Description: the cidr list to allow traffic from/to

icmpcode.Description: error code for this icmp message

aclid.Description: The network of the vm the ACL will be created for

number.Description: The network of the vm the ACL will be created for

icmptype.Description: type of the icmp message being sent

Resources.Name: VPC
Resources.Description: Creates a VPC

cidr.Description: the cidr of the VPC. All VPC guest networks' cidrs should be within this CIDR

zoneid.Description: the ID of the availability zone

vpcofferingid.Description: the ID of the VPC offering

displaytext.Description: the display text of the VPC

account.Description: the account associated with the VPC. Must be used with the domainId parameter.

domainid.Description: the domain ID associated with the VPC. If used with the account parameter returns the VPC associated with the account for the specified domain.

networkdomain.Description: VPC network domain. All networks inside the VPC will belong to this domain

Resources.Name: Volume
Resources.Description: Creates a disk volume from a disk offering. This disk volume must still be attached to a virtual machine to make use of it.

name.Description: the name of the disk volume

domainid.Description: the domain ID associated with the disk offering. If used with the account parameter returns the disk volume associated with the account for the specified domain.

projectid.Description: the project associated with the volume. Mutually exclusive with account parameter

displayvolume.Description: an optional field, whether to display the volume to the end user or not.

snapshotid.Description: the snapshot ID for the disk volume. Either diskOfferingId or snapshotId must be passed in.

diskofferingid.Description: the ID of the disk offering. Either diskOfferingId or snapshotId must be passed in.

account.Description: the account associated with the disk volume. Must be used with the domainId parameter.

zoneid.Description: the ID of the availability zone

Resources.Name: ToLoadBalancerRule
Resources.Description: Assigns virtual machine or a list of virtual machines to a load balancer rule.

id.Description: the ID of the load balancer rule

virtualmachineids.Description: the list of IDs of the virtual machine that are being assigned to the load balancer rule(i.e. virtualMachineIds=1,2,3)

Resources.Name: VirtualMachine
Resources.Description: Starts a virtual machine.

id.Description: The ID of the virtual machine

hostid.Description: destination Host ID to deploy the VM to - parameter available for root admin only

Resources.Name: RemoteAccessVpn
Resources.Description: Creates a l2tp/ipsec remote access vpn

publicipid.Description: public ip address id of the vpn server

account.Description: an optional account for the VPN. Must be used with domainId.

domainid.Description: an optional domainId for the VPN. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used.

openfirewall.Description: if true, firewall rule for source/end pubic port is automatically created; if false - firewall rule has to be created explicitely. Has value true by default

iprange.Description: the range of ip addresses to allocate to vpn clients. The first ip in the range will be taken by the vpn server

Resources.Name: IpAddress
Resources.Description: Acquires and associates a public IP to an account.

networkid.Description: The network this ip address should be associated to.

domainid.Description: the ID of the domain to associate with this IP address

account.Description: the account to associate with this IP address

vpcid.Description: the VPC you want the ip address to be associated with

regionid.Description: region ID from where portable ip is to be associated.

zoneid.Description: the ID of the availability zone you want to acquire an public IP address from

isportable.Description: should be set to true if public IP is required to be transferable across zones, if not specified defaults to false

Resources.Name: VpnUser
Resources.Description: Adds vpn users

projectid.Description: add vpn user to the specific project

account.Description: an optional account for the vpn user. Must be used with domainId.

domainid.Description: an optional domainId for the vpn user. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used.

Resources.Name: Project
Resources.Description: Creates a project

account.Description: account who will be Admin for the project

domainid.Description: domain ID of the account owning a project

Resources.Name: LoadBalancerRule
Resources.Description: Creates a load balancer rule

publicport.Description: the public port from where the network traffic will be load balanced from

privateport.Description: the private port of the private ip address/virtual machine where the network traffic will be load balanced to

name.Description: name of the load balancer rule

description.Description: the description of the load balancer rule

networkid.Description: The guest network this rule will be created for. Required when public Ip address is not associated with any Guest network yet (VPC case)

openfirewall.Description: if true, firewall rule for source/end pubic port is automatically created; if false - firewall rule has to be created explicitely. If not specified 1) defaulted to false when LB rule is being created for VPC guest network 2) in all other cases defaulted to true

account.Description: the account associated with the load balancer. Must be used with the domainId parameter.

domainid.Description: the domain ID associated with the load balancer

publicipid.Description: public ip address id from where the network traffic will be load balanced from

zoneid.Description: zone where the load balancer is going to be created. This parameter is required when LB service provider is ElasticLoadBalancerVm

cidrlist.Description: the cidr list to forward traffic from

Resources.Name: AutoScalePolicy
Resources.Description: Creates an autoscale policy for a provision or deprovision action, the action is taken when the all the conditions evaluates to true for the specified duration. The policy is in effect once it is attached to a autscale vm group.

action.Description: the action to be executed if all the conditions evaluate to true for the specified duration.

duration.Description: the duration for which the conditions have to be true before action is taken

conditionids.Description: the list of IDs of the conditions that are being evaluated on every interval

quiettime.Description: the cool down period for which the policy should not be evaluated after the action has been taken

Resources.Name: LBStickinessPolicy
Resources.Description: Creates a Load Balancer stickiness policy

methodname.Description: name of the LB Stickiness policy method, possible values can be obtained from ListNetworks API

lbruleid.Description: the ID of the load balancer rule

name.Description: name of the LB Stickiness policy

description.Description: the description of the LB Stickiness policy

Resources.Name: Snapshot
Resources.Description: Creates an instant snapshot of a volume.

volumeid.Description: The ID of the disk volume

domainid.Description: The domain ID of the snapshot. If used with the account parameter, specifies a domain for the account associated with the disk volume.

account.Description: The account of the snapshot. The account parameter must be used with the domainId parameter.

policyid.Description: policy id of the snapshot, if this is null, then use MANUAL_POLICY.

Resources.Name: FirewallRule
Resources.Description: Creates a firewall rule for a given ip address

protocol.Description: the protocol for the firewall rule. Valid values are TCP/UDP/ICMP.

ipaddressid.Description: the IP address id of the port forwarding rule

startport.Description: the starting port of firewall rule

cidrlist.Description: the cidr list to forward traffic from

icmpcode.Description: error code for this icmp message

icmptype.Description: type of the icmp message being sent

endport.Description: the ending port of firewall rule
